intro: Lyonnetia alpina, commonly known as the alpine Lyonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Lyonnetia alpina is a herbaceous perennial that produces slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its foliage consists of alternate, simple leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive, slightly serrated edge.
